qas.question: What are the 67th, 69th, and 70th floors of the GE Building at Rockerfeller Center nicknamed?
What do these floors serve as?
What type of elevator is featured?
How long is the short trip?
The special effects include blue light, music playing and what else?

answers.text: various animations are also displayed on the ceiling

context: Guests ascending to the 67th, 69th, and 70th level <a1_0>observation decks<a1_0/> (dubbed <a0_0>"Top of the Rock"<a0_0/>) atop the GE Building at Rockefeller Center in New York City ride a <a2_0>high-speed glass-top<a2_0/> elevator. When entering the cab, it appears to be any normal elevator ride. However, once the cab begins moving, the interior lights turn off and a special blue light above the cab turns on. This lights the entire shaft, so riders can see the moving cab through its glass ceiling as it rises and lowers through the shaft. Music plays and <a4_0>various animations are also displayed on the ceiling<a4_0/>. The entire ride takes <a3_0>about 60 seconds<a3_0/>.
